definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: I said at a meeting held in Dazhai that a failing agriculture would be an obstruction to industrial development.
sentences.chinese: 我在大寨会上说，农业搞不好就要拖工业的后腿。

sentences.english: Dazhai are representative of one of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 是大寨艰苦创业的代表人物之一。

sentences.english: A little lovely chinese girl sang another song to me.
sentences.chinese: 广西龙胜大寨村的可爱女孩唱了另一首歌给我听。

sentences.english: Little lovely chinese girl sang a song to me.
sentences.chinese: 广西龙胜大寨村的可爱小女孩唱歌给我听。

sentences.english: Beach. Emulating Da-Zhai period, River took farmland, on the river to build a dam Shun.
sentences.chinese: 学大寨时期，河两岸修了农田，靠河边筑了顺水坝。

sentences.english: One of our local guides was a member of the Dazhai Party Committee.
sentences.chinese: 当地导游中的一位是大寨党委委员。

definition: Yingpan, common place name ("army camp")/place near Jintian village 金田村[Jin1 tian2 cun1] in Guangxi where the Taiping Tianguo rebels took their oaths in 1851/place in Xinfeng county 新豐縣|新丰县[Xin1 feng1 Xian4] traditional camping place of brigands/Yingpan township, place name/Yingpan in Shangluo prefecture, Shaanxi/Yingpan township in Yunnan/(many others)
Tucheng city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names
old place name (up to Tang), in Hengshan county 橫山縣|横山县, Yulin, Shaanxi
